<div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As our Commercial Sales Manager you will co-drive activities in the sales team together with the Account Manager as well as contributing to strong competitive solutions by ensuring a high transparency and clarity on the customer’s business cases.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   It is your responsibility to perform commercial evaluation of risk and opportunity analysis in alignment with experts and stakeholders and prepare approval documentation, present and get approved sufficient mandate on legal, commercial and financial risks during approval meetings with senior management. You will manage clarification, annotation, mark-up and negotiation of T&amp;Cs with commercial and financial implications, develop negotiation strategy on commercial terms and conditions as well as lead commercial and legal negotiations\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In this role you will support early customer engagement and collaboration including consult customers on commercial aspects, financing models, financial engineering and contractual details just as you will support the development of a winning strategy with commercial inputs and estimations. You will be leading the commercial aspects of contract negations and be responsible for the contract signature. You will be contributing to bid generation in alignment with all stakeholders.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will maintain the following responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Responsible for the internal approval processes of new sales<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support preparation of project specific sales forecasts and budgets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensuring that prices and conditions in the signed contracts are inside the mandate<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participating in knowledge sharing on an ongoing basis by implementation, identification and registration of lessons learned<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In charge of new entity creation when required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Setting expectations, motivating and developing a high-performance environment<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The ideal candidate has an academical background in Business Administration, Finance, Legal or comparable education with extensive professional experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have international project sales experience, preferably in the (wind) energy or construction industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have profound knowledge in legal aspects, project financing, commercial topics, calculation methods\u002Ffinance models, contract management and contract negotiation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> It is important that you have the ability to understand customer commercial requirements and bid evaluation methods and you have strong awareness of commercial financial topics (bonds, escalation, currency, indemnities, liabilities, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A team player with customer focus, initiative and assertiveness<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High degree of accountability and commitment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The ability to build strong internal relationships across departments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent communication and negotiation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willingness to travel and work in a global environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluency (speaking, reading, writing) in the English language<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch and public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Germany and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Junior\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Senior\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Completes budget planning, financial planning, actual-versus-plan-analysis, benchmarking, forecasting and reporting activities, for Offshore execution projects.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Offshore Project Controlling team we are looking for a Project Controller in Hamburg or Paris. As Project Controller you are the Financial Business Partner to both Commercial Project Manager as well for Technical Project Managers. You will be part of different international project teams and will interface with colleagues in Accounting and Business Controlling.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Project Controller you are responsible for controlling, planning, and reporting of assigned construction contracts in Germany, France, and other countries. The role is focused on Project Financial KPIs for Profit and Loss, Balance Sheet and Free Cash Flow. The tasks can vary as the project execution progress in the design, manufacturing, and installation of the wind turbines, but the KPIs are reported on monthly basis. Tasks in the project controller responsibility:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Manage the forecast process by organizing reviews and managing data from stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyze actuals and cost to complete for the project; explain deviations using cost drivers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Implement financial forecast in SAP4HANA and contribute to monthly reporting for your projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support Commercial Project Manager and Management team with ad hoc requests.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Contribute with expertise on financial topics e.g. VAT, Tax, Export control, Internal Controls.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Project Controller you will also be part of a Global Project Controlling team and thereby getting the chance to contribute to improvement projects or key user activities e.g. process descriptions, work optimization solutions, IT system testing, training other colleagues.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As personal profile we are looking for a candidate who can meet following or similar criteria:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>You are passionate about renewable business and want to learn a lot in the job.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are a team player, and you take ownership and contribute to the success of the project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are structured, organized and can keep the overview while deep diving into details.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are valuing open and direct communication and constructive feedback.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are motivated by working in a dynamic, changing environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As qualifications we are looking for a candidate who can meet following or similar criteria:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>You have a university degree in Finance, Accounting, International Business or Finance &amp; IT.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You know your way around out IT landscape IT (Excel, SAP, Power BI) and like working with and structuring big data.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You have gained a few years experience in Accounting \u002FControlling\u002F Audit field (full time\u002Finternship).<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You have a solid understanding of and experience with percentage-of-completion accounting as well as a general knowledge about local taxes and accounting rules in Germany and France.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are business fluent in English. German and\u002For French language skills are an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are living in\u002Fare willing to relocate to the Hamburg or Paris area and look forward to travel occasionally.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li>A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Local benefits such as subsided lunch and public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people \n  <div>\n   https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future? \n  <div>\n   https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Germany and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i><br> We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Also, among these responsibilities you will:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Supports completion of financial analysis, planning and controlling activities, and all related business administration activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports consolidation of accounting, financial reporting, and other finance related operations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepares invoices, monitors outstanding receivables and performs routine reports for professionals and management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains general financial information in the respective information system.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provides general qualified support for Finance Professionals and Finance Management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will collaborate with our team and contribute to ongoing projects<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft von Natur und Technik. Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Wir sind stolz auf die Flexibilität, die wir unseren Mitarbeitern bieten und setzen uns dafür ein, eine Belegschaft aufzubauen, die mit dem Unternehmen wachsen kann. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ablaufstörungen beheben bzw. beheben lassen, Störungsursachen soweit möglich feststellen, Störungsbeschreibung weitergeben<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Durchführung Teilschritte der Montage nach Anleitung<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Durchführung von Reparaturarbeiten nach Anleitung<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Anpassung von Produktkomponenten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vorbereitung der Erzeugnisse zum Transport nach detaillierter Vorgabe<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Wartungs- und Reinigungsarbeiten nach Anleitung durchführen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mechanisches Messen sowie mechanisches Prüfen nach detaillierter Anleitung<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bewegen von Komponenten unter zu Hilfenahme einfacher Hebevorrichtung (z.B. Ameise, Hubvorrichtung)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Planung, Vorbereitung von Maschinen für den Einsatz, Montage und Demontage von Maschinen, Neubau\u002F Anpassung von Betriebsmitteln, Werkteilen und Geräten (z.B. Reparaturen von Vorrichtungen) in enger Abstimmung mit der Instandhaltung; Dokumentation im System<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dokumentation von Fehlern und Nacharbeiten im System<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vorbereitung und Durchführung von mechanischen Prüfungen nach vorgegebenen Abläufen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Begleitung der Instandhaltung, Warten von Anlagen und Hilfsgeräten<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. Wir verfügen über integrative Rekrutierungsprozesse speziell für Schwerbehinderte in Deutschland und bemühen uns, die Arbeitsräume auf Ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse zuzuschneiden. In Fällen von Schwerbehinderung werden Bewerber, die gleich qualifiziert sind, bevorzugt berücksichtigt.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Bitte haben Sie Verständnis dafür, dass wir keine Papierbewerbungen entgegennehmen und es keinen Anspruch auf Rückversand gibt. Leider können wir Initiativbewerbungen im Zuge der Optimierung des Bewerbungsprozesses ebenfalls nicht berücksichtigen. Alle Bewerbungsunterlagen, die uns über den klassischen Postweg erreichen, werden gemäß der DSGVO vernichtet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.<\u002Fi>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a passionate Product Strategist to join our strategic portfolio management team within our PLM department in the Service Business Unit. In that role, you will work closely with our idea &amp; innovation manager, business intelligence manager, product developers, sales colleagues and business developers in the regions making sure we are attracting, engaging and developing customer fitting products and services.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your new role will include\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will translate complex service business ideas into understandable aftermarket product concepts that evolve and enhance the aftermarket product portfolio offered by Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You serve es as an expert on how to shape our product portfolio ecosystem capabilities for Service, while we put more focus on opportunities and solutions that uniquely improve the customers experience and drive growth<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will together with our idea and innovation manager facilitate customer workshops during ideation to identify and develop open-ended aftermarket business opportunities via design thinking methodology for the next 2-3 year development cycle<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In your new role you will plan and manage customer market research projects and data analysis to constantly measure our product portfolio fit against customers overall goals and objectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will enhance and execute our customer segmentation strategy by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting customer preferences and motivations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What will convince us\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li><i> You are a game changer:<\u002Fi> you are an extrovert, creative, intuitive, empathic but also analytical person with the capability to translate customers behavior, needs, wishes and habits into successful products<\u002Fli>\n  <li><i> You are a storyteller:<\u002Fi> you can transform any topic in a compelling story and convince the audience to engage and embark on a joint product development journey with you<\u002Fli>\n  <li><i> You are a connector:<\u002Fi> you find the sweet spot in the center of desirability, feasibility, and viability while connecting the dots interdisciplinary<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extensive working experience with proven ability to drive user centricity in a product business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preferably you hold certificates in design thinking and related disciplines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You hold a Master’s degree in business, engineering, or other related digital disciplines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Clear communication &amp; stakeholder management skills and <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Testing newly developed control algorithms and optimization programmes. The scope focuses on utility-scale hybrid power plants (e.g. combinations of wind, solar, electrolyzers and energy storage).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Deploying the new control systems on the prototype and configuring the site as required for each test.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding the requirements of the control objective and translating them into a detailed testing campaign and running the tests on an existing prototype.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Executing detailed test campaigns and drafting test reports and lessons learned<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working closely with the Control Engineers to understand the new control concepts, specify testing plans and providing test feedback.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proposing ways to mitigate test failures and introduce algorithm improvements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Engineering degree in Electrical Engineering, Control Engineering, Power Systems or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in working on power plant sites and commissioning \u002F testing of systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Awareness of site safety – ideally with training in electrical safety<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in developing and testing control algorithms in simulation and on the systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of communication protocols such as Modbus TCP\u002FIP with focus on testing the communications using tools like Wireshark.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in IEC 61131-3 PLC programming<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in Matlab \u002F Simulink is beneficial<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in setting up PLCs and configuring communications is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Background in renewable power generation, power to X control systems, energy storage are significant advantages<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluency in English, both orally and in writing. German and\u002For Danish would be an advantage<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability and interest in developing and\u002For reviewing engineering documentation and support materials<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good organizational skills, with ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch and public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a dedicated and highly motivated Technical Project Manager, who will:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Be the person that connects all involved parties in the entire Lifetime of a project from first internal kick-off in the Sales phase up to Handover to the customer in Project Execution phase<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be responsible for the technical solution to be sold and installed on site.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be responsible for validation of any non-standard features on Projects in the Sales Phase<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Act as First Point of Contact for any electrical and mechanical topics from Costumers and Site into the Engineering Department, both in the Sales phase and the Execution phase of projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage the technical review of Employer requirements and provide project specific documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be responsible for the identification of the sold product and translation into a Configuration used for the Bill of Materials<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Define deliverables and deadlines to and from the Sales and Project Execution Team and track turbine configurations and issues disclosed during installation and commission that require modifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Are specifying project issue resolutions and you are providing disposition of equipment non-conformances in close alignment with the site manager<\u002Fli>\n  <li> If required, you are traveling to sites to provide technical guidance to site personnel.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical\u002FMechanical Engineering or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have relevant experience, including project management experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have knowledge of wind turbine technology and tower manufacturing processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You ideally are familiar with engineering disciplines associated with the design of wind turbines, and preferably with manufacturing practices for wind turbine and auxiliary component assemblies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are proactive and innovative, and you have a systematic and quality-oriented approach to your assignments as well as the ability to keep an overview even under pressure<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills and thrive in an international environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are fluent in English both orally and in writing; Spanish would be a plus<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch and public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Germany and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     Siemens Gamesa hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft der Natur und der Technologie. Helfen Sie uns, für die Energieherausforderungen von morgen gerüstet zu sein und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - arbeiten Sie mit im Team, um eine bessere Zukunft für uns und unseren Planeten zu schaffen.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, wo auch immer auf der Welt sie sich befinden mögen. Wir sind stolz auf die Flexibilität, die wir unseren Mitarbeitern bieten, und wir sind bestrebt, eine Belegschaft aufzubauen, die mit dem Unternehmen wachsen kann. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit. Wir schätzen die Vielfalt und setzen uns dafür ein, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Eigenverantwortung, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Unsere Projektmanager setzen die Verträge für Windfarm um, die zwischen Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy und dem Kunden unterzeichnet wurden. Die typischen Verträge umfassen die Herstellung, den Transport und die Installation bis hin zur endgültigen Inbetriebnahme der Windturbinen am Projektstandort des Kunden.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Ihr Beitrag zum gemeinsamen Erfolg\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Sie werden an der Stelle sein, an der alles zusammenkommt und wir grüne Energie Wirklichkeit werden lassen. Sie werden eng mit den Baustellen zusammenarbeiten und dafür sorgen, dass alle Puzzleteile zusammenpassen, damit wir diese Projekte rechtzeitig realisieren können.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie beraten Kunden über technische Lösungen.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> In dieser Funktion tragen Sie die volle Verantwortung für die Durchführung von Onshore-Windprojekten in der Region CEE\u002FME, exklusiv für den deutschen Markt.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie koordinieren die Gesamtplanung der Projekte und entscheiden über die Zuweisung von Ressourcen.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie überwachen Meilensteine und die Einhaltung von Budgets und leiten Maßnahmen ein, um die Kosten und Auswirkungen eventueller Abweichungen gegenüber der Planung zu minimieren.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie leiten und koordinieren alle vorübergehend zugewiesenen Projektmitarbeiter.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Das bringen Sie mit\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und der Wille, die Energiewende aktiv zu gestalten. Darüber hinaus suchen wir...\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Sie verfügen über einen Master-Abschluss in einem relevanten Bereich (Elektrotechnik\u002FMaschinenbau) – sowie ein breites technisches Hintergrundverständnis .<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie haben nachweislich mehr als 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Projektmanagement und verfügen über eine international anerkannte Projektmanagement-Zertifizierung (IPMA).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie sprechen und schreiben fließend Englisch und Deutsch .<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie verfügen über fortgeschrittene Kommunikations- und Verhandlungsfähigkeiten und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise, da Sie in ständigem Kontakt mit Kunden, externen Auftragnehmern oder anderen Beteiligten stehen werden.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie verfügen über fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse des MS-Office-Pakets und von Primavera P6. SAP-Kenntnisse wären von Vorteil, sind aber nicht zwingend erforderlich.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie sind ein Teamplayer und verfügen über ausgeprägte Führungsqualitäten.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sie verfügen über die nötige Flexibilität, um bei Bedarf zu reisen, wobei die Reisetätigkeit nicht mehr als 30 % Ihrer Arbeitszeit in Anspruch nehmen sollte.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Als Gegenleistung für Ihr Engagement bieten wir Ihnen\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Teil unserer Mission: “Clean energy for generations to come” zu werden<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ein internationales Team, das die Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien teilt<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Vertrauen und Empowerment zur Verwirklichung eigener Ideen<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung, um innerhalb unserer Organisation zu wachsen<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Flexible Arbeitszeiten<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Vom Arbeitgeber finanzierte Altersvorsorge<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Attraktives Vergütungspaket<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Lokale Leistungen wie z.B. Essensgeldzuschuß, Jobticket, Mitarbeiterrabatte und vieles mehr<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Befähigung unserer Mitarbeiter\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n      https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Wie stellen Sie sich die Zukunft vor?\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n      https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Unser globales Team steht an vorderster Front bei der Bewältigung der Klimakrise und der Verringerung der Kohlenstoffemissionen - der größten Herausforderung, vor der wir stehen.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Schwerbehinderte Bewerber sind aufgefordert, sich an uns zu wenden. Wir verfügen über integrative Rekrutierungsprozesse speziell für schwerbehinderte Menschen in Deutschland und tun unser Möglichstes, um die Arbeitsplätze an Ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse anzupassen. Bei gleicher Eignung werden schwerbehinderte Bewerberinnen und Bewerber bevorzugt berücksichtigt.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i><br> We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.<\u002Fi>\n Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n      <br> \n      <br> Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Die international agierende Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist in Deutschland, Frankreich, Österreich, Italien, Großbritannien und in Polen vertreten.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Abwicklung von Service- und Wartungsaufträgen an Windkraftanlagen<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Durchführung von Reparaturmaßnahmen an elektronischen, maschinenbaulichen und hydraulischen Komponenten<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Reparaturmaßnahmen im Bereich der Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Dokumentation der Arbeitseinsätze und Berichtswesen<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Mitwirkung bei der Inbetriebnahme der Anlagen bei Bedarf<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Das bringst Du mit\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Lifting Engineer in Project Execution for the German Market\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organisation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Are you an inspirational and organised manager with a background in Engineer?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Do you want to contribute to the ongoing battle against climate change?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If so, we would love to hear from you!\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a Lifting Engineer to join our team as active technical and regulatory advisor within the Northern Europe and Middle East Onshore Service business. Ensure compliance with QHSE SGRE standards and relevant country and international legislation as appropriate.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> This is an opportunity to be part of a growing team within a dynamic business, delivering innovation to the renewable energy.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of your key tasks will include but not be limited to\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Define, own, implement and maintain the Operations lifting strategy in-line with relevant legislation. Form development and training plans for lifting personnel as appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Define templates and standard associated with lifting. Check and approve lift plans and safety documentation and act as the escalation point &amp; technical authority for unusual lift planning or wherever sites require support.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all relevant 'controlled' documentation and drawings are appropriately 'Created', 'Checked', and 'Approved' to provide a maintained 'Audit-Robust' environment in which lifts, across Operations, are planned and conducted.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Where necessary, act as the AP to plan lifts (including heavy lifts).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure correct methods of assessing and managing risks are used to maximise utilisation of operational resources. Ensure that APs are working efficiently and take responsibility for the lift planning hours for Onshore Heavy Lift.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure subcontracted lifting product and service companies maintain standards and uphold compliance obligations and check (and where necessary Comment\u002FRevise\u002FReject) specialist supplier proposals with respect to safety, quality, cost, and delivery.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive the SGRE safety culture on site and implement, maintain and communicate the strict adherence to the organisation’s environmental, health and safety and security procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead, encourage, document and monitor subcontractor, supplier and site team regime of safety audit, inspection and progress meetings to drive a continually improving safety culture<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collate, communicate and improve site safety performance to encourage an open and continually improving safety culture.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain and develop good working relationships with customer organisation(s) and escalate issues when appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide functional leadership to lifting personnel, as overall responsible for Lifting, and providing required mentoring and coaching.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain an overview of the preparation\u002Fprovision of HSE related documentation i.e. statutory inspections, Ensure all work is carried out in line with SGRE standards and in line with German legislation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide communication of best-practice knowledge and awareness of industry developments, competitor strategies and approaches to heavy lift activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop and maintain databases and processes with respect to lifting activities and lifting equipment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Professional experience – Electrical\u002FMechanical preferably (training certificate)\u002FNVQ level 3 or 4 \u002F electronics or full apprenticeship scheme will be preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lifting experience in the German market.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous experience of working in the wind industry would be advantageous<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A self-motivated individual with ability to work under tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical knowledge working on different wind turbines would be preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience working with MS Office applications would be an advantage<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent German and English language skills, both orally and in writing.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team Player who is comfortable working in a dynamic, diverse and international team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft von Natur und Technologie. Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n  <br> \n  <br> Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen. In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n  <br> \n  <br> Die Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist eine hundertprozentige Tochtergesellschaft der Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy S.A. mit Sitz in Zamudio, Spanien und bündelt die operativen Geschäftsbereiche Service und Wartung, Service Sales Technical Support sowie Life Cycle Engineering von europaweit installierten Windkraftanlagen. Die international agierende Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist in Deutschland, Frankreich, Österreich, Italien, Großbritannien und in Polen vertreten.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Abwicklung von Service- und Wartungsaufträgen an Windkraftanlagen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Durchführung von Reparaturmaßnahmen an elektronischen, maschinenbaulichen und hydraulischen Komponenten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reparaturmaßnahmen im Bereich der Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dokumentation der Arbeitseinsätze und Berichtswesen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mitwirkung bei der Inbetriebnahme der Anlagen bei Bedarf<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. Die international agierende Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist in Deutschland, Frankreich, Österreich, Italien, Großbritannien und in Polen vertreten.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Abwicklung von Service- und Wartungsaufträgen an Windkraftanlagen<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Durchführung von Reparaturmaßnahmen an elektronischen, maschinenbaulichen und hydraulischen Komponenten<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Reparaturmaßnahmen im Bereich der Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Dokumentation der Arbeitseinsätze und Berichtswesen<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Mitwirkung bei der Inbetriebnahme der Anlagen bei Bedarf<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Das bringst Du mit\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In this role you will be responsible for technical day to day offshore operations reporting to the local Site Manager. The role is default in the SOV Site office but for difficult technical cases, on turbine work may be required. During the ramp-up phase of this project throughout 2023 office work from onshore will be required as well.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Technician - and Customer management will play an integral part of the day to day role, so leadership and communication skills are vital.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Accountable for providing technical, safety and leadership competence at a local level. The role will mainly focus on wind farm availability whilst executing planned and unplanned works.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Technical planning of work, providing details such as documentation, tools, parts and time needed to complete a task.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advising coordinators \u002F technicians \u002F stock keeper \u002F site managers about technical scope and advising about material that is needed for a specific troubleshoot event.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Day to day technical prioritization of unplanned work in wind turbine generator systems and handling of technical cases as well as task preparation (i.e. Retrofits \u002F Annual Service).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review, alignment and follow up with our customer on specific reports for monitoring and inspection.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Writing and reviewing specific work instructions, risk assessments and checklist if needed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation and presentation of technical toolbox topics based pre-work on Safety Alerts and findings in the field.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical approval of completed works (incl. final release of completed checklists).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Approval of working permits which involves technical as well as electrical skills like LV and HV.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. You are the right candidate if you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Have completed a secondary\u002Fvocational education, you have an electrician background and a track record in Offshore Wind.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have Ownership of Environment, Quality, Safety and Operational topics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Are flexible regarding work demand, proactive regarding tackling challenges and result driven regarding project outcomes and you show high commitment and engagement throughout.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have an advanced understanding of electrical &amp; mechanical systems, all turbine components and systems (LV and HV skills are preferrable).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally have Level 6 Troubleshooter experience from our Direct Drive turbines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have excellent knowledge of spoken and written English (Advanced level); additional languages (especially German or Danish) are considered a benefit.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Comprehensive IT user skills:\n   <ul>\n    <li> MS Office and Windows 365 is a must<\u002Fli>\n    <li> SAP knowledge is desirable<\u002Fli>\n    <li> MORS knowledge is desirable<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have the ability to work 14 day shifts offshore throughout the year according to business demands.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> A great project team in the ramp-up phase of a new turbine <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n         Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n         We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n         In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n         How to contribute to our vision\n        <br> As a junior software developer on our control system team, you will be developing the energy management system (EMS) software that optimize the hybrid power plant operations, including the production of green hydrogen. Every day you will be in close interplay with team members and internal stakeholders coming from all over the world. The job responsibilities as junior software developer evolve around the full software development process from specifying and implementing to testing. This includes but not limited to:\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div><\u002Fdiv>\n       <ul>\n        <li> Build the framework to deploy models in production that will be use every day for energy management decision decisions.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Prototyping and developing new features leveraging the most appropriate programming languages\u002Fframework\u002Flibrary to meet technical requirements.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Defect fixing and refactoring of existing source code.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Testing the software, including unit testing, component testing and acceptance testing.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Process, clean, prepare, visualize and present various kind of data to establish a basis of further analysis\u002Fdevelopment.<\u002Fli>\n        <li> Producing technical report and documenting test results.<\u002Fli>\n       <\u002Ful>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> A successfully completed university degree in Software engineering, Control Engineering or similar.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Programming experience in Python including data science libraries (e.g., Pandas and NumPy)and preferably one additional modern<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in designing and maintain CI\u002FCD pipelines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Programming languages such as C#, C++ and Java.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in relational databases (ideally Postgres)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience with static code analysis, unit and integration testing, and test automation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience developing software in a professional environment, using agile methods and versioning tools (e.g., Git).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have a good understanding of energy markets, energy management and optimization (operations research).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have basic understanding of power systems, renewable generation, low carbon technologies (e.g., storage and electrolyzer).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong communication skills in spoken and written English.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft von Natur und Technologie. Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n  <br> \n  <br> Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Wir sind stolz auf die Flexibilität, die wir unseren Mitarbeitern bieten und setzen uns dafür ein, eine Belegschaft aufzubauen, die mit dem Unternehmen wachsen kann. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen. In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n  <br> \n  <br> Die Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist eine hundertprozentige Tochtergesellschaft der Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy S.A. mit Sitz in Zamudio, Spanien und bündelt die operativen Geschäftsbereiche Service und Wartung, Service Sales Technical Support sowie Life Cycle Engineering von europaweit installierten Windkraftanlagen. Die international agierende Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist in Deutschland, Frankreich, Österreich, Italien, Großbritannien und in Polen vertreten.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Abwicklung von Service- und Wartungsaufträgen an Windkraftanlagen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Durchführung von Reparaturmaßnahmen an elektronischen, maschinenbaulichen und hydraulischen Komponenten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reparaturmaßnahmen im Bereich der Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dokumentation der Arbeitseinsätze und Berichtswesen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mitwirkung bei der Inbetriebnahme der Anlagen bei Bedarf<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. We are looking for a Head of Service Industrialization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> The Head of Service Industrialization is an integrated member of our dynamic and engaged Service Global Operations function. As Head of Service Industrialization, it will be your responsibility to shape and develop the vision and mission of the department, provide strategic direction to the Global Major Projects team, the Global Resource Management team and the Service Industrialization Center.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are overall accountable to ensure that the respective department targets are met, contributing to SGRE’s overall strategy. Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change are important aspects to make a difference. Strong leadership skills and a safety-first mindset are key factors for the success of the candidate in this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Head of Service Industrialization is an integrated member of our dynamic and engaged Service Global Operations function. As Head of Service Industrialization, it will be your responsibility to shape and develop the vision and mission of the department, provide strategic direction to the Global Major Projects team, the Global Resource Management team and the Service Industrialization Center. You are overall accountable to ensure that the respective department targets are met, contributing to SGRE’s overall strategy. The candidate will be responsible for all personnel and management matters and thereby also for attracting talents and succession planning and be responsible for deliverables of the respective teams.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As the selected candidate you will lead and develop our Service Industrialization department in Global Operations and shape this newly created global function. Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change are important aspects to make a difference. Strong leadership skills and a safety-first mindset are key factors for the success of the candidate in this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What are your responsibilities?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Overall responsible for the development and deployment of the End2End Safe system approach, operationalizing safety standards, ensuring the successful implementation and thereby setting global safety standards.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Represent Service in the product development process to ensure operational requirements are incorporated in the product design.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Validate new products\u002F services and ensure readiness of such ahead of deployment in the regions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure strategic and operational readiness of regional Operations as the owner of the resources, competence, tooling and equipment strategies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop a structured approach for forecasting and planning resource, competence, tooling and equipment demands globally and regionally in alignment with the respective strategy.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide execution support for first-of-its kind activities &amp; complex campaigns, establish best practices and ensure their deployment on a global level.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure development and roll-out of best practices for the execution of highly complex activities and campaigns setting performance targets and supporting the qualification of the regional resources to achieve such targets.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   What are your qualifications?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Safety is your choice and you lead by example always putting safety first. You have experience with safety-leadership and the implementation of safety standards in operations or project environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Minimum of 10-15 years of relevant experience with 5-8 years of line-management experience, ideally in the wind or service industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are an experienced leader and have shown the ability to develop a strategic vision and roadmap and implement such strategy in a complex organization taking a holistic end-to-end perspective.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have demonstrated to be impactful across different cultural environments implementing change across various business functions and locations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are experienced leading and mentoring large and high-performing teams that drive business success.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have shown the ability to successfully engage and build lasting relationships with stakeholders at all levels of an organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong leadership skills with a can-do attitude, open to feedback from peers and managers and willingness to learn and develop<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Performs technical, mainly pre-defined tasks for accomplishing defined service delivery work for customer equipment.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft von Natur und Technologie. Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n  <br> \n  <br> Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Wir sind stolz auf die Flexibilität, die wir unseren Mitarbeitern bieten und setzen uns dafür ein, eine Belegschaft aufzubauen, die mit dem Unternehmen wachsen kann. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen. In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n  <br> \n  <br> Die Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist eine hundertprozentige Tochtergesellschaft der Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy S.A. mit Sitz in Zamudio, Spanien und bündelt die operativen Geschäftsbereiche Service und Wartung, Service Sales Technical Support sowie Life Cycle Engineering von europaweit installierten Windkraftanlagen. Die international agierende Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist in Deutschland, Frankreich, Österreich, Italien, Großbritannien und in Polen vertreten.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Abwicklung von Service- und Wartungsaufträgen an Windkraftanlagen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Durchführung von Reparaturmaßnahmen an elektronischen, maschinenbaulichen und hydraulischen Komponenten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reparaturmaßnahmen im Bereich der Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dokumentation der Arbeitseinsätze und Berichtswesen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mitwirkung bei der Inbetriebnahme der Anlagen bei Bedarf<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. Darüber hinaus suchen wir...\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung als Mechatroniker oder im elektrotechnischen Bereich<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik, Hydraulik, Leistungselektronik und allgemeine Mechanik<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Erste Erfahrungen in der Windbranche sind von Vorteil<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Eigenständige, strukturierte und erfolgsorientierte Arbeitsweise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reisebereitschaft und Bereitschaft zu Wochenenddiensten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Teamfähigkeit<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gute Englischkenntnisse<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Körperliche Fitness<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Höhentauglichkeit (G41)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Führerschein Klasse B<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Als Gegenleistung für Dein Engagement bieten wir Dir\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Werde ein Teil unserer Mission für Nachhaltigkeit: Saubere Energie für kommende Generationen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ein globales Team aus verschiedenen Kollegen, die die Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien teilen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vertrauen und Empowerment zur Verwirklichung der eigenen Ideen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Persönliche und berufliche Entwicklung, um intern innerhalb unserer Organisation zu wachsen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible Arbeitszeiten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attraktives Vergütungspaket<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lokale Leistungen wie z.B. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH is a wholly owned subsidiary of Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy S.A., headquartered in Zamudio, Spain, and combines the operational business units Service and Maintenance, Service Sales Technical Support, and Life Cycle Engineering of wind turbines installed throughout Europe. Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH operates internationally and is represented in Germany, France, Austria, Italy, the United Kingdom and Poland.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n       How to contribute to our vision\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Processing of service and maintenance orders on wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Execution of repair measures on electronic, mechanical and hydraulic components<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Repair measures in the field of control and regulation technology<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Documentation of work assignments and reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participation in the commissioning of the plants if required<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Completed vocational training as a mechatronics engineer or in the electrotechnical field\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Good knowledge of control engineering, hydraulics, power electronics and general mechanics\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Initial experience in the wind industry is an advantage\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Independent, structured and success-oriented way of working\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Willingness to travel and to work weekends\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to work in a team\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Good command of English\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Physical fitness\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to work at heights (G41)\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Class B driving license\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return for your commitment we offer you:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Be a part of our mission for sustainability: clean energy for future generations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Confidence and empowerment to realize your own ideas<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive compensation package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as canteen, job ticket, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft von Natur und Technik. Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden.
