Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Erstellung von Fertigungszeichnungen unter Berücksichtigung einschlägiger Normen und Richtlinien<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Detaillierung von Baugruppen anhand des Konstruktionsentwurfs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Änderungskonstruktionen an bestehenden Bauteilen und Baugruppen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Zeichnungsableitung von Komponenten und Baugruppen im Sondermaschinenbereich oder von Betriebsmitteln<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Überwachung und Aufnahme von Abweichungen zum Referenzlayout im Rahmen der Day-to-Day Schnittstellenkommunikation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Beachtung und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von Normen, Richtlinien und Vorschriften im Bezug zum Layout (Brandschutz, Fluchtwege, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pflege von bestehenden Layouts und Durchführung von Kollisionsprüfung<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Stücklistenerstellung und –pflege von Werkzeugverzeichnissen, inkl. Datenpflege im Teamcenter<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mitwirken bei der Qualitätssicherung von Planunterlagen und Revisionszeichnungen<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. Darüber hinaus suchen wir...\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum technischen Produktdesigner (m\u002Fw\u002Fd) oder technischen Zeichner (m\u002Fw\u002Fd)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im genannten Aufgabengebiet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sammlung erster Projekterfahrung<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sicherer Umgang mit CAD-Programmen, idealerweise AutoCAD und Siemens NX<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fließende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Als Gegenleistung für Dein Engagement bieten wir Dir\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Werde ein Teil unserer Mission für Nachhaltigkeit: Saubere Energie für kommende Generationen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ein globales Team aus verschiedenen Kollegen, die die Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien teilen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vertrauen und Empowerment zur Verwirklichung der eigenen Ideen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Persönliche und berufliche Entwicklung, um intern innerhalb unserer Organisation zu wachsen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Arbeitgeberfinanzierte Pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attraktives Vergütungspaket<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lokale Leistungen wie z.B. vergünstigtes Mittagessen, Mitarbeiterrabatte und vieles mehr<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Werde Teil von unserem Standort Cuxhaven:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fen-int\u002Fexplore\u002Fjournal\u002Foffshore-wind-power-in-cuxhaven\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wie stellst Du Dir die Zukunft vor?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Unser globales Team ist an vorderster Front dabei, den Klimawandel zu erreichen und den Kohlenstoffausstoß zu reduzieren - die größte Herausforderung, vor der wir stehen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Schwerbehinderte Bewerber sind aufgefordert, sich an uns zu wenden. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for an experienced Project Manager profile to take over responsibility for our German offshore Service Projects Hohe See &amp; Albatros. As Service Operations Manager you will lead and manage a service contract including full responsibility towards the customer and under active involvement of internal Siemens Gamesa stakeholders. Due to the size and complexity of the project in question we are looking for candidates with many years of experience and a proven track record in similar projects or roles.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Proactively drive HSE through visible safety leadership and suitable programs. Set standards, expectations, guidelines and establish a strong safety culture to achieve an incident and injury free project execution in alignment with our zero-harm ambition.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Plan and manage service operations, adopting our principles throughout the execution phase to ensure maximum availability and optimal cost while meeting project schedules and key operational targets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Build and manage customer relationships through effective and systematic communication. Ensure contract requirements are met and claims managed systematically. Ensure close collaboration with the customer based on joint targets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assume responsibility for financial performance of the project in terms of gross profit, revenue, cash flow and project related assets. Identify and manage risks &amp; opportunities systematically. Identify opportunities for aftermarket sales and execute respective services jointly with relevant stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Report regularly on operational and financial performance based on the project plan and defined KPI. Ensure leadership is aware of critical issues and prepare decision making where necessary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive and encourage innovation, continuous improvement and standardization in own area of responsibility and beyond.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead, mentor and develop the operational team in line with our corporate values.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Service Cost &amp; value engineering department we are looking for an Advanced Procurement Engineer to join our team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As an Advanced Procurement Engineer you will represent the procurement function in the development of new cost out solutions in close collaboration with service technology and PI and suppliers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will ensure that our suppliers are involved early in the new development of service solutions and actively participating in developing cost out ideas for the Service Business Organization\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Areas of responsibility:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Be the procurement representative in R&amp;D\u002F innovation projects within the business unit.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assure early involvement of procurement in the development phase of service solutions and products.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Integrate suppliers in Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy MCP (Material cost productivity) development phase.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assess and develop suppliers from the technological standpoint (if necessary, jointly with interface partners) in order to concentrate on the best suppliers and reduce single sources.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communicate status within project team, on cost and sourcing .<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proactively develop and drive cost out solutions based on technical know how<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that Procurement SE organization is involved at all in the development &amp; cost-out projects (New Unit CVE, TE IND CCO and SE)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> First point of contact for TE on NPI ( new product introduction) projects based on Design to cost \u002F design competition.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Besides a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change, we are also looking for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> A motivating team player, who is resilient, responsible, and structured with excellent communication skills. You interact with stakeholders high and low in the organization as well as external stakeholders. You are motivated by providing quality results within the deadlines and are happy to work in a dynamic organization and environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> We expect you to hold a relevant Engineering degree combined with several years of experience with one or more of the following: Project Procurement, Design or Manufacturing of (specific component\u002Ftechnology).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience in Project Management and working in cross-functional teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience within the IT technologies Microsoft Office, SAP, Teamcenter.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> It is a big advantage if you thrive in a multi-cultural environment and are familiar with working in large organizations. It is therefore important that you have excellent English language skills, both written and spoken.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willingness to travel when it is required (20%)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated. Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your new role\n  <br> Offshore Construction has the mission statement “we make happen, safely” and if you want to become a key driver and part of the construction senior management team this is a great opportunity for you.\n  <br> Siemens Gamesa is the market and technology leader in offshore wind and this role is key to remain in a leading spot for the medium and long term. Our construction organization manages critical resources such as ports, vessels and technicians and has the capacity and competencies to install up to 500 offshore wind turbines globally per year. We cover all geographies from US to Europe and APAC.\n  <br> \n  <br> More specifically to your role and team\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will be part of the construction senior management team and directly report to the Global Head of Construction offshore wind<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will lead a growing team of 35 employees divided in four sub teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your team drives operational performance tracking and management of deviations (Lean construction workflows, continuous improvement)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your team provides operational expert support to ongoing construction execution projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your team drives our digital innovation and data management roadmap in construction. This includes project management and implementation of defined digitalization projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your team drives the strategic development of future construction concepts. E.g., how to install next generation turbines, floating wind<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your qualifications\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Besides the passion for wind turbines and a sense for the importance to lead the change, we are looking for the following qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Significant work experience, ideally in project execution and construction for offshore \u002F onshore wind<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leadership experience managing an international team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Project Management, Business Administration, Economics, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team player with excellent communication skills and ability to work independently<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Result-orientated, self-driven and persistent person while also being open<\u002Fli>\n  <li> English: fluent plus ideally a second language e.g., German, Danish or Spanish<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> In the area of CRM (Customer Relationship Management), Sales and Projects execution, with focus to the solutions related with B2B integration (eCommerce and Customer ERP integration for Sales):<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understands business goals, objectives and needs of the business solution environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develops software design, application-related IT solutions and its individual components, balances alternatives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Is also responsible for the design of data architectures supporting data modelling and engineering in the context of data analytics (Data Stewardship).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employs techniques and systems to extract knowledge or insights from data through data analysis such as statistics, data mining and predictive analytics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Validates the IT solution architecture against business requirements and assumptions and prioritizes them.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contributes and supports planning, budgeting, design and alignment of business processes and corresponding IT solution architecture.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> May coordinate relevant unit and integration tests, and documents new IT Solutions Architectures, and maintains existing.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports the integration of necessary IT security guidelines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads and manages projects in the role of IT Project Manager<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reports to an IT Portfolio Management Manager.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A degree in IT, Industrial Engineering or similar.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relevant work experience in IT tools implementation or IT process related projects, in particular integrating ERPs or different applications (internals to Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy or with external -customers, partners…-), eCommerce applications for selling catalogue products and services (if based on SAP products would be very positive assessed).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluency in English, both orally and in writing.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge in SAP B2B solution as SAP Commerce Cloud. As well knowledge in portal tools, in particular Sitecore will be very positive assessed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> International experience within a complex organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A person with great analytical skills, customer and solution oriented and value driven.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexibility to travel (25%)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft von Natur und Technologie. Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Wir sind stolz auf die Flexibilität, die wir unseren Mitarbeitern bieten und setzen uns dafür ein, eine Belegschaft aufzubauen, die mit dem Unternehmen wachsen kann. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen. In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Die Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist eine hundertprozentige Tochtergesellschaft der Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy S.A. mit Sitz in Zamudio, Spanien und bündelt die operativen Geschäftsbereiche Service und Wartung, Service Sales Technical Support sowie Life Cycle Engineering von europaweit installierten Windkraftanlagen. Die international agierende Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist in Deutschland, Frankreich, Österreich, Italien, Großbritannien und in Polen vertreten.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wir suchen einen Servicemonteur (m\u002Fw\u002Fx) am Standort Simmern.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Abwicklung von Service- und Wartungsaufträgen an Windkraftanlagen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Durchführung von Reparaturmaßnahmen an elektronischen, maschinenbaulichen und hydraulischen Komponenten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reparaturmaßnahmen im Bereich der Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dokumentation der Arbeitseinsätze und Berichtswesen<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You are responsible for coordinating the procurement activities in the areas of cranes and site installation for the portfolio of projects of Onshore in the German market<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are owner and driver of commodity strategy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are handling the tendering and awarding processes of specific projects in close cooperation with the involved parties<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are responsible for defining and implementing negotiation approaches and strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are incorporating an international base of suppliers. The coordination takes place with the team of experts and key stakeholders to support the procurement process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> According to requirements you are incorporating the management to coordinate awarding and negotiation strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are preparing, executing and moderating awarding negotiations which includes concluding the contract as well as reporting, also by using advanced negotiation concepts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are ensuring that the contents of the contracts are reflected back-to-back in supplier offers and supplier contracts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are coordinating the flow of information to the regional as well as to the main interfaces of the project<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please note that the position is a maternity cover with a limited contract for 2 years.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for...\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You have received a university degree in Business Administration, Business Engineering, Procurement or a similar field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have at least 3 years of work experience in the area of service procurement, preferably within construction or logistics, combined with good analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have good knowledge in the area of contract law and possess strong negotiating skills, especially in international business relationships<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have good technical and commercial skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Senior Commercial Project manager is responsible for the completion of all commercial\u002Ffinancial related tasks to contribute to the project success, leads a very small team of dedicated Commercial Project Managers or Interim Commercial Managers; manages, coaches, supports and develops Commercial Project Managers in managing projects according to defined Project Management policies and Booking guidelines, programs and standards.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Senior Commercial Project Manager, you will:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Head a dedicated team of permanent or temporary Interim Commercial Project Manager and\u002For Commercial Project Management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Act as personal advisor to unit's Senior Management, in all Project and Interim Management related issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Initiate and oversee continuous development of Commercial Project Management infrastructure in the regions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Generally manage the project together with the Project Managers or Interim Project Managers with regards to all financial aspects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure books and records are at any time representing a true and fair picture of the project financials (actuals and forecasts) and report<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure the application and the continuous management of financial guarantees, bonds and project securities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure proper execution of all internal and external tasks related to finance and legal: reporting, audit, treasury, taxes compliance, ECC, customs and alike<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure compliance with all internal and external rules, laws, standards and guidelines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure, together with the PM, proper management of Risks and Opportunities, including credit and F\u002FX risks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support PM in the management of all project stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure, together with the PM and the Package Managers, that all customer and supplier contracts and requirements are fulfilled<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the PM in all commercial aspects of customer negotiations regarding contracts, claims, and variation orders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain business case supporting the PM for maximizing value through ensuring optimal commercial solutions to minimize NCCs in the project finances; maximize project profitability together with PM<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be accountable as World Project Controller for all project shares<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Take final decision on organization in alignment with the region related budgets in the respective area of interim support.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Take care for effective risk management measures, not only for the Project Management organization assigned, support also the region heads<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that assigned Project Management organization meets all agreed performance goals<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> More than 10 years of proofed experience in positions\u002Fareas such as Commercial Project Management and\u002For Operations Controlling (Plants or Regions)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Very good knowledge of FRG Guidelines and Booking rules<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Broad experience in accounting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Senior experience in reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Senior experience in handling R&amp;Os<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in financial auditing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coaching and planning capabilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Decision making and Driver seat approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent knowledge of English, both written and spoken<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch and public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n It is your responsibility to ensure process adherence and raise the maturity level of our processes.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. able to work in ambiguous situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to work effectively at all levels in an organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong end user focus orientation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrates a consultative and flexible style with excellent negotiation and stakeholder management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong time planning and organizing skills and an ability to work under pressure<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch and public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. You will be responsible in engaging with the employees through effective communications, exchange and change strategies to empower them to adopt and enhance their user experience and satisfaction. In your role, you will be exposed to international teams and top executives in the company.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for you, who wants to make real what matters and who wants to change the world to renewable energy.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The ideal candidate holds an academic degree in Business Administration, Marketing &amp; Communications, or IT in combination with business. Successful candidates will have a demonstrable track record of being a self-starter and achieving their goals in the face of challenges, with a desire to enhance and improve the organisation that you work for, and a passion for understanding how change initiatives can utilize bi-directional information exchange channels to target users and enhance their technology adoption, utilization and proficiency.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Experience in the following areas would be advantageous:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> A solid understanding of how people go through a change and the change process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Most importantly, you challenge yourself and your colleagues to achieve the best results. In this position, you will be responsible for the daily activities within a scope of Towers and suppliers. The major activities will include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Implementing Commodity strategies to ensure long-term capacity &amp; cost-efficient supply of materials.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contribute to our Supply Chain footprint, drive GVS initiatives and achieve single source reduction.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare and conduct negotiations to obtain the highest feasible savings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify and resolve complex problems and apply problem-solving skills in order to deal with challenging situations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide purchasing assistance to support design on cost reduction activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Close cooperation wit Tower Controller to report commercial project status<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive\u002Fcooperate with other departments to implement cost reduction measures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support sales with budget offers<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This is a temporary position and contract will be for 12 months.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Performs technical, mainly pre-defined tasks for accomplishing defined service delivery work for customer equipment.\n <div>\n   Die Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist eine hundertprozentige Tochtergesellschaft der Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy S.A. mit Sitz in Zamudio, Spanien und bündelt die operativen Geschäftsbereiche Service und Wartung, Service Sales Technical Support sowie Life Cycle Engineering von europaweit installierten Windkraftanlagen. Die international agierende Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Service GmbH ist in Deutschland, Frankreich, Österreich, Italien, Großbritannien und in Polen vertreten.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Wir sind stolz auf die Flexibilität, die wir unseren Mitarbeitern bieten und setzen uns dafür ein, eine Belegschaft aufzubauen, die mit dem Unternehmen wachsen kann. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen. In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Durchführung von Tauschen mechanischer und elektrischer Großkomponenten (im Team) an Onshore installierten Windenergieanlange (WEAs)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Durchführung von Reparaturmaßnahmen an den Komponenten falls erforderlich<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vor- und Nachbereitung der Werkzeuge und Betriebsmittel entsprechend der Arbeitsaufträge<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Erstellung von Arbeitsauftragsprotokollen und Dokumentationen gemäß interner Richtlinien unter Anweisung<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Umsetzung sowie Einhaltung von fach- und servicespezifischen Richtlinien und Anweisungen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mitwirkung an der Verbesserung von Tauschverfahren<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. Service, Aufstellung, Komponententausch oder Inbetriebnahme von WEAs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ein elektrotechnischer Hintergrund wäre von Vorteil<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gute Englischkenntnisse<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Körperliche Fitness und Höhentauglichkeit<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Eigenständige, strukturierte und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Kommunikationsstärke und Teamfähigkeit<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bereitschaft, sich in neue Themengebiete einzuarbeiten<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hohes Maß an Reisebereitschaft<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Als Gegenleistung für Dein Engagement bieten wir Dir\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Werde ein Teil unserer Mission für Nachhaltigkeit: Saubere Energie für kommende Generationen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ein globales Team aus verschiedenen Kollegen, die die Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien teilen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vertrauen und Empowerment zur Verwirklichung der eigenen Ideen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Persönliche und berufliche Entwicklung, um intern innerhalb unserer Organisation zu wachsen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attraktives Vergütungspaket<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Befähigung unserer Mitarbeiter\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wie stellen Sie sich die Zukunft vor?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Unser globales Team steht an vorderster Front bei der Bewältigung der Klimakrise und der Verringerung der Kohlenstoffemissionen - der größten Herausforderung, vor der wir stehen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Schwerbehinderte Bewerber sind aufgefordert, sich an uns zu wenden. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Commodity Manager for Service Business Development projects - specifically H2 &amp; Power2X - you not only become a member of the respective cross functional core project team but also connect corresponding project demands with the respective Commodity expertise given in our Procurement community. This way, not only pooling effects are explored, but corresponding procurement scope is further been integrated as part of the respective functional ownership and sourcing strategy. Simultaneously, you deliver external project demands &amp; drive building a sustainable Procurement structure for high scale production to follow. You will be reporting to the Head of New Business Development and Innovation Procurement.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> As Commodity Manager for SE Business Development projects, you will have functional responsibility for our Service Procurement scope towards BE projects by driving competitively project specific tenders in line with Procurement guidelines, ensure harmonization of sourcing approaches with respective global commodity strategies and actively manage project related sourcing demands end to end.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Representing our “One Procurement” mindset, you will engage yourself among project related stakeholders by taking a holistic view over consistently total cost-based decisions and taking into account cross functional needs, next to savings, lead times and operational supplier performances. An anytime well-structured, tool-based approach will thereby help you in documenting project progress, plan necessary steps tactically, and define a long-term commodity approach contributing globally to the success of our current &amp; future business.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure usage of globally defined methods, processes and systems to achieve high sourcing efficiency and process compliance over respective project demands (e.g. compliant Purchase-to-Pay (P2P) process, Procurement guidelines, IT systems).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure solid collaboration with project related stakeholders and relevant SE-P commodity managers and\u002For corporate function such as Cost Value Engineering and Supplier Development to ensure successful implementations of the different innovation-based initiatives and establishing strategic supplier partnerships.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure a close cooperation with Internal Customers ensuring customer care and early involvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Being a role model of collaboration with key stakeholders within and outside Procurement, you are an active driver of change.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Besides a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change, we are also looking for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> A motivating team player, who is resilient, responsible, and structured with excellent communication skills to interact with stakeholders high and low in the organization as well as external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are motivated by providing quality results within the deadlines. You have an analytical mindset, exceptional coordination and collaboration skills, commercial understanding, solid technical competencies, strong cross-functional leadership skills and thrive in a dynamic environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You also hold a master’s degree in Engineering, Business, or Economics and preferably have extensive experience from Project Procurement\u002FCommercial functions within Wind Energy Offshore, Construction and\u002F or O&amp;M project business. You are data driven, have excellent negotiation and communication skills, enabling you to convey your message in a concise and efficient manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a deep understanding and professional experience with Procurement Contracts for goods and services, especially in innovation and development areas, is an excellent negotiator and have good customer service skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> It is a big advantage if you thrive in a multi-cultural environment and are familiar with working in large and remote organizations. It is therefore important that you have excellent English language skills, both written and spoken.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are ready to travel when it is required (20%)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated. Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as public transport tickets, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Germany and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i><br> We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. opportunity review workshops with all stakeholders and ensure transparency on commercial evaluation of identified risks\u002Fcontingencies and opportunities)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure compliance with released guidance provided by all internal stakeholders (Memos, F-Price, Budgets, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead negotiations of terms and conditions with the Support of the Account Manager in contract negotiations for the WTG and\u002For Service products<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify, manage, and mitigate contract risk, including commercial risks e.g. cash-flow, currency, hedging risks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Secure financial instruments in terms of payment, insurances, export control, liability regime, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuous Improvement: Ensure collection of lessons learned.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contract Review: Launch Independent Contract Review request once contract\u002Fagreement is ready for signature.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project Handover: Complete and timely deliver all financial\u002Fcommercial relevant documents and inform the project execution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate activities with non-Sales functions such as: SFS, legal, taxes, insurance, ECC, Compliance, Treasury.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform periodic audits for data consistency, accuracy of CRM financial data for their projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. funktionsübergreifenden Partnern und Teilnahme an Projekt-\u002FVertriebsmeetings zur frühzeitigen Bereitstellung von Informationen über den Beschaffungsmarkt und bevorzugte Lieferanten zur Projektziele zu erreichen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Aushandeln und Abschließen von Einzel- und Rahmenverträgen für Dienstleistungen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Digitalisierung und Nutzung digitaler Tools zur Beschaffungsvorschriften gemäß Compliance, Organisationsstandards<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringen Sie mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft and frame\u002Fcontract agreements for services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Digitalization and usage of digital tools to facilitate and streamline procurement processes as well as evaluate installation \u002F commissioning services within the bid project team and develop sub-supplier and partners as well as coordinate the interface between internal and external partners<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Carry out tenders on your own, ensure that they are complete and correct, and monitor the provision of the necessary documents by the relevant specialist departments as well as have a significant share in the contract negotiations with the supplier and apply Procurement regulations as per Compliance, organization standards<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. procurement of Logistics services (preferably heavy haulage)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> International work experience, working abroad experience would be beneficial<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge and experience in supplier qualification process (e.g. ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and ISO 45001)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced knowledge of commercial and contract law (work\u002Fservice and technical products) knowledge and acumen, with a good understanding of all relevant global commodities and relevant markets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced knowledge in strategic and tactical procurement in project environment (Procurement Strategy, Supplier strategies, Negotiation skills and Tactics)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent in German (Level C2) and English, both spoken and written as well as negotiation skills in an international environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communicating with many different stakeholders in a structured and concise manner comes easy for you<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You challenge the status quo and work with different stakeholders on solutions constructively<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a Transactions (M&amp;A) Professional who will support the regions in a Global Business Unit organization, called Wind Farm Solutions (WFS), in the evaluation, structuring, negotiation and execution of strategic renewable energy projects with stakeholders such as utilities, developers, IPPs, funds, etc, where SGRE could generate value. WFS is part of the Global Sales &amp; Marketing Organization reporting directly to the CEO of the Onshore Business Unit. The primary target of WFS is to ensure the exclusive wind turbine delivery by SGRE via such project development activity and to generate additional revenue streams. The Transactions (M&amp;A) Professional will work closely with the Head of Transactions, in particular cases with the Head of WFS as well as with the support teams involved in a typical transaction (e.g. sales, , legal, tax, finance).. As part of the role, you will also:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Structure and contractually establish strategic partnerships with developers, and investors on global level to maximize project value and ensure SGRE exclusivity<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identification and management of potential targets, investors and financiers for energy projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Screen opportunities and initial assessment of identified opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate and negotiate commercial agreements to participate in third party opportunities (co-investment, bid bonds, acquisition) presented by the different regions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support project due diligence and assist\u002Fsupport with negotiation of joint development agreements, shareholder agreements, share purchase agreements and similar investment agreements (e.g. Development Support Agreements, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supervise, support or lead (as relevant) project-related contract negotiations such as PPAs and financing documentation of the projects (in collaboration with internal\u002F external stakeholders supporting the process)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare and manage internal approval process for transaction on global level with the support of the regional sales manager and Transactions Department (e.g. SGRE SBA PM017)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare and evaluate business cases for projects and analyze transaction KPIs (IRR, LCoE, NPV)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Financial modelling and project valuation with support of financial analyst in WFS team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate multidisciplinary teams\u002Fconsultants (financial, technical, legal), both external and internal<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate for a successful delivery of onshore wind project origination targets, brownfield\u002Facquisition project development or co-development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follow up the progress of co-development or co-investments and support department manager to attend JVs governance bodies and propose decisions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure routine focus on project quality, progression, budgeting, internal tracking, for all development projects throughout their lifetime and selling process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Elaborate follow-up reports transaction status<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Receive, filter, register and tune all the requests for financial and technical assistance sent by the Sales &amp; Marketing <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy, we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Are you a dedicated and driven individual, who has a background in Project Management?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If so, we would love to hear from you.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Within our department we are currently looking for a dedicated technical Project Manager to lead complex heavy lift projects within the Major Component Replacement team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Project Manager your key role will be to design, develop and manage projects, according to defined Project Management (PM) standards, Stakeholder requirements and Business Conduct Guidelines e.g. Tax regulations, Export Control, Environment Health &amp; Safety (EHS).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This is an opportunity to be part of a growing team within a dynamic business, delivering innovation to the renewable energy\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of your key tasks will include, but not be limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Project responsibility in terms of time, cost and quality delivered - from scoping phase until project closure\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensuring that Environment, Health &amp; Safety standards, procedures, and plans are implemented at project sites to create a Home Safe environment\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Defining the technical project scope together with the technical department and supporting the tender process together with procurement\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supporting the CPM (Critical Path Method) with the budget and cost planning structure, risk analysis and contingency plan\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Plan resources, cranes, material &amp; tools, and logistics for the execution\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Executing the project according to agreed working packages, budget, and timelines\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Controlling, Preparing and Maintaining the project status (financially as well as technically)\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Adhering to budgets and initiating actions to minimize non-conformance cost\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Leading the daily project execution and stakeholder engagement activities\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supporting on internal improvement, quality, and standardization projects\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. Additionally, you fit to the following requirements:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     A university degree in engineering or any equivalent degree or relevant work experience (technical or commercial studies incl. project management courses), preferably with a focus on the wind business\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Several years of working experience with project management - preferably of international service\u002Frepair projects - with multiple stakeholders and suppliers\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     It is an advantage if you have documented your experience through relevant Project Management Certification\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experience with completing heavy lift projects involving mobile cranes and have a basic understanding of the technical aspects related to the wind business\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experience of managing 3rd party contractors always ensuring performance meets required standard with regards to Safety and Quality\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Project Management Certification would be an advantage\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Structured approach to your assignments (incl. structured documentation) and can handle project scope changes\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Willingness to travel and provide visible leadership to onsite project execution team\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Hands on experience in Microsoft Office 365 applications, in particular Excel, Power Point and SharePoint\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our Service business unit, we are looking for an experienced Integration Architect for OT to join our dynamic and engaged Operational Excellence (‘OE’) department, which is part of Global Operations. The Operational Excellence department is responsible for definition and deployment of standard processes and tools for Service Operations and drive continuous improvement activities. The interface and collaboration with global functions and regions within Siemens Gamesa is key to the success of our OE team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The selected candidate will join our ‘Operational Applications &amp; Digitalization’ team in OE, who is responsible to drive IT and OT Transition towards One consolidated and harmonized solution for Operations business based on our Operational Framework .To improve our competitiveness while growing faster than the market by creating additional value by implementing innovative digital solutions aiming for an increased safety &amp; productivity of Operations business in the field and in the back office.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> As an Integration Architect for OT, it will be your responsibility to ensure the development and deployment of digital End-to-End OT solutions in and for Service Operations. Following different developments in SGRE Innovation, PLM@SGRE process or in the relevant Agile Release Trains according to SAFe you will be joining the different projects representing Service Operations to mainly ensure implementation of OPS specific requirements and to ensure set-up of operational concepts for the different developments. You will be responsible to ensure E2E integration between our OT landscape and our existing and future IT landscape and architecture to ensure business operation and stability. Therefore, as part of our IT Business Collaboration Model you will be representing Service Operations in the respective capability cluster for “Managing Digital Services”. The scope of this role will mainly cover OT developments, SCADA and turbine control systems but is not limited to this. The role will be directly reporting to the Head of Operational Applications &amp; Digitalization.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   More specifically your key tasks will include – but not limited – to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Representation of Service Operations in development projects such as:\n   <ul>\n    <li> Turbine Control and Software<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Power Plant Solutions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Digital Innovation<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Development of operational and functional concept for Service Operations for new digital products<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Facilitate knowledge sharing with regions to ensure feedback loops to and from development process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Facilitate broad alignment in Service Operations regarding new product introduction<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support in building business cases that evaluate full operational impacts of new solutions\u002Fproducts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Recommend how new products should be implemented and coordinate the operational input from product requirement specification<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and approval of relevant DSA – Digital Solution Agreements for new At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa hat eine Vision für erneuerbare Energien: Wir glauben an die Kraft von Natur und Technik. Hilf uns, die Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu meistern und einen grünen Fußabdruck zu hinterlassen - lass uns gemeinsam mit unserem Team eine bessere Zukunft für unseren Planeten schaffen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wir konzentrieren uns darauf, die besten Mitarbeiter einzustellen, egal wo auf der Welt sie sich befinden. Wir sind stolz auf die Flexibilität, die wir unseren Mitarbeitern bieten und setzen uns dafür ein, eine Belegschaft aufzubauen, die mit dem Unternehmen wachsen kann. Siemens Gamesa ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit sorgt. Wir zelebrieren die Vielfalt und engagieren uns dafür, ein integratives Umfeld für alle Mitarbeiter zu schaffen.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In unserer Kultur des Vertrauens setzen wir auf Empowerment, Vielfalt und kontinuierliches Lernen. Die Wertschätzung unserer Mitarbeiter macht uns zu einem globalen Team, in dem die Sicherheit unserer Kollegen im Mittelpunkt unserer Organisation steht.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dein Beitrag zu unserer Vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Als Betriebsmittelplaner Schraubtechnik, werden Sie folgende Aufgaben haben:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Die Auslegung, Beschaffung und Inbetriebnahme der gesamten Schraubtechnik im Werk Cuxhaven.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Die Sicherstellung einer sicheren und techn. einwandfreien Produktion im 3rd level Bereich.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Betreuung und Mitarbeit bei Produktupdates, Produktwechsel bezüglich der Betriebsmittel Schraubtechnik<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Eigenständige Identifizierung und Umsetzung von Projekten zur Verbesserung der Prozesssicherheit von Schraubtechnik, sowie die Umsetzung in Zusammenarbeit mit allen Supportfunktionen bzw. Schnittstellenabteilungen, Lieferanten und der Produktion im Werk Cuxhaven<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pflege und Weiterentwicklung der Schraubfallliste zusammen mit den entsprechenden Schnittstellen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sie sind ein Ansprechpartner im Bereich der Kalibrierung der Schraubtechnik<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sie unterstützen bei der Erfassung der Schraubdaten (Hardware, IT-Infrastruktur)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mitarbeit bei der Auswahl und Bereitstellung von Softwarelösungen bezüglich Prozessabbildung (Schraubtechnik, Werkerführung).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sie unterstützen im Bereich Dokumentation von Schraubdaten in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Bereich Engineering und der Qualitätssicherung (Digitalisierung)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Das bringst Du mit\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien und ein Gespür für den Klimawandel. Darüber hinaus suchen wir...\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Sie bringen ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem techn. Bereich, vorzugsweise Maschinenbau oder einer vergleichbaren Qualifikation mit.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sie verfügen über mehr als 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung, sowie über Projekt- bzw. Prozesserfahrung im industriellen Bereich, vorzugsweise im Bereich der Schraubtechnik.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sie haben gute kaufmännische und betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse, sowie fundierte Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement im Bereich Betriebsmittelplanung<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sie bringen Kenntnisse im Bereich der Schraubtechnik mit und wissen worauf es bei einer Schraubverbindung ankommt.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sie arbeiten teamorientiert und verfügen über fachübergreifendes Denken.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Wünschenswert sind zusätzliche Qualifikationen im Bereich Schraubtechnik (z.B.: Schraubfachingenieur)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Als Gegenleistung für Dein Engagement bieten wir Dir\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Werde ein Teil unserer
